search_parameters.q: Ethnic Power and the Public Schools: The New York City School Strike of 1968 Ritterband, Paul Sociology of Education

search_information.query_displayed: Ethnic Power and the Public Schools: The New York City School Strike of 1968 Ritterband, Paul Sociology of Education

organic_results.title: Ethnic power and the public schools: the new york city school strike of 1968
organic_results.snippet: The New York City school strike was more a struggle between ethnic communities than a labor-management dispute. Once the strike began, educational issues were displaced by ethnic power concerns. The pro-union forces attempted to close the schools while the pro-community control forces attempted to keep them open. Over the system as a whole, the probability of success for both sides was largely a function of the ethnic character of the neighborhood and the school. White ethnics exerted their influence within the school system …

publication_info.summary: P Ritterband - Sociology of Education, 1974 - JSTOR
